ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Did We not make the earth a receptacle
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Have We not made the earth a repository
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Did We not make the earth a receptacle,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Did We not make the earth as a gathering place
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Did We not make the earth a storehouse?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Have We not made the earth Kifat (a receptacle)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Have We not made the earth to draw together to itself,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Made We not the earth to be a housing

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Have We not made the earth a receptacle,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Have We not made the earth a receptacle.

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Have We not made the earth (as a place) to draw together.

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Have We not made the earth a housing
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Did We not make the earth a homestead?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Have We not made the earth a container
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [77:25] Have We not made the earth a receptacle (kifātan is a verbal noun, from kafata, meaning damma, ‘enclosed’), that is, an enclosure,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Have We not made the earth a receptacle) to contain them
